titles.title: To allow employees of the United States Government who have been furloughed, due to a lapse in appropriations, to volunteer to work to serve the needs of the people of the United States, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight. to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil Service.

committee.name: House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight

bill.summary: 12/13/1995--Introduced. Authorizes an officer or employee of the U.S. Government or of the District of Columbia (D.C.) government to accept the voluntary services of a Federal or a D.C. government employee, as the case may be, who has been furloughed due to a lapse in appropriations.
